top_categories.workout_context: Bend Dirt Fest's High desert gravel roads, Doubletrack forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 50 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Bend Dirt Fest's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before July.
60ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
When someone attacks on high desert gravel + singletrack, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
50 miles on high desert gravel + singletrack burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
At Bend Dirt Fest, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Bend Dirt Fest. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Bend Dirt Fest, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on high desert gravel + singletrack. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Varied gradients on high desert gravel + singletrack demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 3,000ft of climbing on high desert gravel + singletrack does to your power file on race day.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Bend Dirt Fest’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Bend Dirt Fest. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Bend Dirt Fest requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on high desert gravel + singletrack to build confidence. Expect: high desert gravel roads, doubletrack, singletrack mix.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 50 miles of high desert gravel + singletrack in Bend, Oregon.
